title: "spack buildcache create ..." fails if the a file already exists

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

In version v0.14, `spack buildcache create ...` would only report a warning if the build cache of a dependency already existed.

Now, on version v0.15, it returns an error and suggests I use the option `-f` to overwrite the existing files. I don't want to do that - it's slow and wastes time.

How can I get the old behaviour back?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git checkout releases/v0.15
$ spack buildcache create -a -u -d src_mirror speck
$ spack buildcache create -a -u -d src_mirror speck
==> Buildcache files will be output to file:///home/vagrant/src_mirror/build_cache
==> Error: 
file:///home/vagrant/src_mirror/build_cache/linux-rhel6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/libuuid-1.0.3/linux-rhel6-x86_64-gcc-7.3.1-libuuid-1.0.3-bqv2qs3zxsth6jn7fnrqqrmf3czxxzke.spack
exists
Use -f option to overwrite.
...
```

In v0.14, it reports lots of warnings, but is otherwise fine:
```console
$ git checkout releases/v0.14
$ spack buildcache create -a -u -d src_mirror speck
$ spack buildcache create -a -u -d src_mirror speck
...
==> creating binary cache file for package freetype@2.10.1%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 
==> Warning: 
file:///home/vagrant/src_mirror/build_cache/linux-rhel6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/freetype-2.10.1/linux-rhel6-x86_64-gcc-7.3.1-freetype-2.10.1-uvy2rw6w6qtekqo4ibr5zuua3zuu5ffx.spack
exists
Use -f option to overwrite.
==> creating binary cache file for package mesa-glu@9.0.1%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 
==> Warning: 
file:///home/vagrant/src_mirror/build_cache/linux-rhel6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/mesa-glu-9.0.1/linux-rhel6-x86_64-gcc-7.3.1-mesa-glu-9.0.1-oz4nxkut7kzrvusucccv6vh7tbsmgjwf.spack
exists
Use -f option to overwrite.
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.15.3
* **Python:** 2.6.6
* **Platform:** linux-rhel6-sandybridge

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
